spirit:register.spirit:name: version
spirit:register.spirit:description: 5.1.0: Added registers to disable/enable CRC32. And also to inject CRC32 errors 5.2.0: Changed the Interrupt Pending to avoid blocking the register update when enable is 0 5.3.0: Added pending_irq register 5.4.0: Changed Logic to Wire in ift_xgmii and ift_gmii

spirit:field.spirit:name: major
spirit:field.spirit:description: Major version

spirit:field.spirit:name: minor
spirit:field.spirit:description: Minor version

spirit:field.spirit:name: patch
spirit:field.spirit:description: Patch version

spirit:register.spirit:name: version
spirit:register.spirit:description: 2.1.0: Added registers to disable/enable CRC32. And also to inject CRC32 errors

spirit:field.spirit:name: major
spirit:field.spirit:description: Major version

spirit:field.spirit:name: minor
spirit:field.spirit:description: Minor version

spirit:field.spirit:name: patch
spirit:field.spirit:description: Patch version

spirit:field.spirit:name: inject_crc32_err
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Assert high to ask the logic to insert one crc32 error when CRC32 logic is implemented.
Write a 1 and HW clears it when completed the action

spirit:field.spirit:name: disable_crc32
spirit:field.spirit:description: When set to 1, and if the CRC32 logic is implemented, disables inclusion of correct CRC32.

spirit:field.spirit:name: crc32_implmntd
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the synthesis parameter value used for CRC32 logic implementation. When 1, it shows the CRC32 logic has been implemented in the logic. Note that, typically CRC32 MUST be implemented in MAC. However, due to some timing issues, we may decide to not have the logic when the system is used in a point-to-point configuration.

spirit:field.spirit:name: dbg_seq_num_en
spirit:field.spirit:description:
When set to 1 it enables the debug logic to insert consecutive sequence numbers in the frame.
Typically, this and the corresponding register in the RX path should be configured before any traffic sent between the TX and RX. Otherwise, there will not be synchrony between the sent and expected sequence numbers for at least one time

spirit:field.spirit:name: en
spirit:field.spirit:description: When set to 1 it enables the block. NOT USED.

spirit:field.spirit:name: pa_word1
spirit:field.spirit:description: Preamble values (upper 3 bytes)

spirit:field.spirit:name: pa_word0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Preamble values (lower 4 bytes)

spirit:field.spirit:name: sfd
spirit:field.spirit:description: The Start of Frame Delimiter (SFD)

spirit:register.spirit:name: da_word1
spirit:register.spirit:description: Destination Address Word1

spirit:field.spirit:name: da_w1
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the MAC Destination address (upper 2 bytes [47:32])

spirit:register.spirit:name: da_word0
spirit:register.spirit:description: Destination Address Word0

spirit:field.spirit:name: da_w0
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the MAC Destination address (lower 4 bytes [31:0])

spirit:register.spirit:name: sa__word1
spirit:register.spirit:description: Source Address Word1

spirit:field.spirit:name: sa_w1
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the MAC Source address (upper 2 bytes [47:32])

spirit:register.spirit:name: sa_word0
spirit:register.spirit:description: Source Address Word0

spirit:field.spirit:name: sa_w0
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the MAC Source address (lower 4 bytes [31:0])

spirit:register.spirit:name: lt
spirit:register.spirit:description: Length/Type Filter

spirit:field.spirit:name: lt_mode
spirit:field.spirit:description: When 0: The LT field is to be the Length of the payload When 1: The LT field is to be the Type of the payload

spirit:field.spirit:name: lt
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the MAC type

spirit:field.spirit:name: idle
spirit:field.spirit:description: Idle character

spirit:register.spirit:name: frm_rate
spirit:register.spirit:description: The extra gap (in addition to the mandatory gap) between each Ethernet frame allowing a fine control of the data throughput on the link.

spirit:field.spirit:name: frm_rate
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the number of idle clock cycles inserted between the frames. For each implementation, it will add frm_rate*bus_size number of MAC bits.

spirit:register.spirit:name: bandwidth_gap
spirit:register.spirit:description: This is the number of idle clock cycles inserted after a specified number of data words (equal to the clock cycles that has data) are reached. For each implementation, it will add bandwidth_gap*bus_size number of MAC bits.

spirit:register.spirit:name: bandwidth_limit
spirit:register.spirit:description: This is the number of data words (equal to the clock cycles that has data) that needs to be reached before Bandwidth Gap can be inserted.

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration.

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: pause_frame
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of pause frames transmitted

spirit:register.spirit:name: out_eop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the PTP EOP seen on the output port to the RS

spirit:register.spirit:name: out_sop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the PTP SOP seen on the output port to the RS

spirit:register.spirit:name: stall_ptp_in
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of cycles the MAC input is stalled

spirit:register.spirit:name: in_eop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the EOP of the PTP packets seen from the clients and after the input stall logic

spirit:register.spirit:name: in_sop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the EOP of the PTP packets seen from the clients and after the input stall logic

spirit:register.spirit:name: fsm_count_beyond_ptp
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the number of cycles the FSM has been beyond the permissible maximum value. This indicates an error in the function of this block

spirit:register.spirit:name: fsm_rollover
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the number of times the input FSM rolled over. This indicates an error in the function of this block

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: media_rs
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: Registers needed for the Media RS in the TX Path

spirit:field.spirit:description: Major version

spirit:field.spirit:name: minor

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_xgmii_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: When 1, and tx_xgmii_en is 0, it enables the XGMII path

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_gmii_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: When 1, and tx_xgmii_en is 0, it enables the GMII path

spirit:register.spirit:name: version
spirit:register.spirit:description: Version 1.1.0: Added Icron Attributes for stats script generation

spirit:field.spirit:name: minor

spirit:field.spirit:name: patch

spirit:register.spirit:name: clear
spirit:register.spirit:description: Synchronous clear for the write clock domain

spirit:field.spirit:name: drp_on_sop
spirit:field.spirit:description: When set, drops the current packet without writing it to the buffer. See Wiki

spirit:field.spirit:name: drp_on_pkt_err
spirit:field.spirit:description: When set, removes the packet from the buffer without presenting it to the output interface upon the ERR bit being set before the notification point. See Wiki

spirit:field.spirit:name: pkt_strm
spirit:field.spirit:description: Selects packet based or streaming based behavior. See Wiki

spirit:field.spirit:name: flw_ctrl_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Enables the flow control. See Wiki

spirit:field.spirit:name: ntfy_lmt
spirit:field.spirit:description: Sets the number of words required to be written into the packet FIFO before a notification will be generated. See wiki

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration for the Write Engine

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: nfifo_dcount
spirit:register.spirit:description: Current level for the notification FIFO in the PFIFO

spirit:field.spirit:name: nfifo_dcount
spirit:field.spirit:description: _icron_water_marker_ _icron_no_counter_

spirit:register.spirit:name: pfifo_dcount
spirit:register.spirit:description: Current level for the packet FIFO in the PFIFO

spirit:field.spirit:name: pfifo_dcount
spirit:field.spirit:description: _icron_water_marker_ _icron_no_counter_

spirit:register.spirit:name: pkt_max_byte_cnt_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count for capped packets in PFIFO write engine, as the result of reaching maximum size in the PFIFO

spirit:register.spirit:name: fifo_full_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count for either of PFIFO or NFIFO being full

spirit:register.spirit:name: pkt_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of packets tagged to be dropped later in the PFIFO read engine

spirit:register.spirit:name: pkt_sop_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of packets flushed in the PFIFO during the SOP phase

spirit:register.spirit:name: wflush_act
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of capped packets in the PFIFO. Note that back-to-back packets are counted as one if they are both capped.

spirit:field.spirit:name: wflush_act
spirit:field.spirit:description: _icron_event_detect_rising_edge_

spirit:register.spirit:name: drp_pkt_rd
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of drop packets flagged to be dropped by the read engine

spirit:register.spirit:name: drp_pkt_wr
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of drop packets by the write engine

spirit:register.spirit:name: flow_ctrl
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of the clock cycles the DRDY is asserted low resulting in flow control

spirit:register.spirit:name: clear
spirit:register.spirit:description: Synchronous clear for the read clock domain

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration for the Read Engine

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: rflush_act
spirit:register.spirit:description: The counts of number of packets flushed from the PFIFO.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rflush_act
spirit:field.spirit:description: _icron_event_detect_rising_edge_

spirit:register.spirit:name: drp_pkt
spirit:register.spirit:description: The counts of drop packet in the PFIFO read engine

spirit:register.spirit:name: flow_ctrl
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of the clock cycles the DRDY is asserted low resulting in flow control

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration for the GMII

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: inbuff_eop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the PTP EOP saved into the buffer

spirit:register.spirit:name: inbuff_sop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the PTP SOP saved into the buffer

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats1
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration for the GMII

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: gmii_outbuff_eop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the PTP EOP after the buffer and seen on the GMII output port

spirit:register.spirit:name: gmii_outbuff_sop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the PTP SOP after the buffer and seen on the GMII output port

spirit:register.spirit:name: gmii_done
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the GMII FSM completing a packet and after an IFG period is also completed

spirit:register.spirit:name: gmii_start
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the GMII FSM starting to process a packet

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats2
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration for the XGMII

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: xgmii_outbuff_eop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the PTP EOP after the buffer and seen on the XGMII output port

spirit:register.spirit:name: xgmii_outbuff_sop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the PTP SOP after the buffer and seen on the XGMII output port

spirit:register.spirit:name: xgmii_done
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the XGMII FSM completing a packet and after an IFG period is also completed

spirit:register.spirit:name: xgmii_start
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the XGMII FSM starting to process a packet

spirit:register.spirit:name: version
spirit:register.spirit:description: 3.1.0: Fixed bug in Max Cycle Error where in certain mode the cycles were included in the count 3.2.0: Changed the Interrupt Pending to avoid blocking the register update when enable is 0 3.3.0: Added pending_irq register

spirit:field.spirit:name: major
spirit:field.spirit:description: Major version

spirit:field.spirit:name: minor
spirit:field.spirit:description: Minor version

spirit:field.spirit:name: patch
spirit:field.spirit:description: Patch version

spirit:field.spirit:name: implemented
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the synthesis parameter value used. When 1, it shows the PTP Guard fix logic has been implemented

spirit:field.spirit:name: activate
spirit:field.spirit:description:
When 1, and if the fix logic is implemented, it instructs the PTP Guard to fix the PTP violations it detects (and reports). Note that there is a synthesis parameter to generate the "fix" logic or not
When 0, no attempt is done to fix (even if the logic exists) and the PTP Guard will only work as a monitor and reports the violations detected.
For full details of the operation, what violations are detected and fixed, and how the fix is done, see the wiki.

spirit:field.spirit:name: max_cycle_mode
spirit:field.spirit:description:
This configures the mode of counting towards max_cycles:
0x0: All PTP cycles are included in the count 0x1: PTP cycles with backpressure (drdy=1'b0) are excluded from the count 0x2: PTP cycles with wait (srdy=1'b0) are excluded from the count 0x3: PTP cycles with either backpressure or wait are excluded from the count. Hence, only "absorbed" PTP cycles are included in the count
Other mode values are reserved

spirit:field.spirit:name: max_cycles
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Sets the maximum number of clock cycles the PTP packet can last between its sop and eop taking into account the max_cycle_mode
When set to 0, it instructs the logic not to fix this violation (when the fix logic is available). However, the monitor will still issue a violation when the cycle count reaches its maximum and rollover.

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: missing_sop_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: Counts the number of PTP violations due to missing sop where the srdy was asserted without a prior sop assertion

spirit:register.spirit:name: missing_eop_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: Counts the number of PTP violations due to missing eop where the PTP had been started but a new sop is seen without ending the previously started PTP

spirit:register.spirit:name: max_cycle_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: Counts the number of PTP violations due to reaching the maximum allowed cycles after starting a new PTP

spirit:register.spirit:name: enable
spirit:register.spirit:description: The enable for the actual interrupt signals. Writing a 1 enables the interrupt.

spirit:field.spirit:name: max_cycle_err
spirit:field.spirit:description: Fires on PTP violations due to reaching the maximum allowed cycles after starting a new PTP

spirit:field.spirit:name: missing_eop_err
spirit:field.spirit:description: Fires on PTP violations due to missing eop where the PTP had been started but a new sop is seen without ending the previously started PTP

spirit:field.spirit:name: missing_sop_err
spirit:field.spirit:description: Fires on PTP violations due to missing sop where the srdy was asserted without a prior sop assertion

spirit:register.spirit:name: pending
spirit:register.spirit:description: The actual interrupt(s) that has triggered. Write a 1 to clear.

spirit:register.spirit:name: pending_irq
spirit:register.spirit:description: Registered version of pending & enable.

spirit:register.spirit:name: raw
spirit:register.spirit:description: The status registered values for the interrupt signals, if applicable.

spirit:field.spirit:name: max_cycle_err
spirit:field.spirit:description: Not used

spirit:field.spirit:name: missing_eop_err
spirit:field.spirit:description: Not used

spirit:field.spirit:name: missing_sop_err
spirit:field.spirit:description: Not used

spirit:field.spirit:name: enable
spirit:field.spirit:description: Connects CH0 to the self-test logic when it is 0x1, provided the proper parameter (p_impl_self_test) is set to "YES"

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: media_gen
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: Registers needed for the Media Generator needed for self-test

spirit:field.spirit:name: major
spirit:field.spirit:description: Major version

spirit:field.spirit:name: minor
spirit:field.spirit:description: Minor version

spirit:field.spirit:name: patch
spirit:field.spirit:description: Patch version

spirit:register.spirit:name: mca_mgen
spirit:register.spirit:description: Media generator configuration register

spirit:field.spirit:name: iwg_cnt
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Media generator inter-word count select. This is the number of srdy "not ready" (srdy = 1'b0) cycles that can be inserted between words.
0 = 0 cycles 1 = 1 cycle 2 = 2 cycles 3 = 0-3 cycles

spirit:field.spirit:name: ifg_cnt
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Media generator inter-frame count select. This is the number of clock cycles that can be inserted between packets.
0 = 0 cycles 1 = 1 cycle 2 = 1023 cycles 3 = rdm 1-1023 cycles

spirit:field.spirit:name: pkt_cnt
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Media generator packet count select.
0 = constant - set ConfigMgenX.Go='0' to stop. 1 = 1 time 2 = 1024 times 3 = 65535 times

spirit:field.spirit:name: pkt_size
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Media generator packet size select.
0 = fix 10 bytes 1 = fix 1000 bytes 2 = inc 1-1023 bytes 3 = rdm 1-1023 bytes

spirit:field.spirit:name: throttle
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Media generator throttle enable. Allows CPU to control media generator transmitter source ready (srdy).
0 = srdy with/without drdy (may cause loss of traffic) 1 = srdy with drdy

spirit:field.spirit:name: mode
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Media generator traffic mode select.
0 = incrementing data 1 = random data

spirit:field.spirit:name: enable
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Media generator enable. Must be set '0' if the corresponding media is trying to connect to the pipe. Can also be set '0' to stop a media generator that is set for continuous mode. Set '1' if setting go '1'.
0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: go
spirit:field.spirit:description: Go/Busy (Cleared by HW)

spirit:register.spirit:name: max_byte
spirit:register.spirit:description: Maximum bytes in incoming PTP bytes

spirit:register.spirit:name: mac_dg_type
spirit:register.spirit:description: MAC Datagram Type used in the out PTP

spirit:register.spirit:name: timer_wait
spirit:register.spirit:description:
Maximum number of clock cycles that is allowed to hold a new incoming PTP before it is put into a MAC Datagram if the input PTPs are not back-to-back and the downstream is not busy. The timer starts when a new PTP is received. This timer gives a control of aggregating input PTPs that are gapped.
Note: A value of 0x0 instructs the logic to not wait for input PTPs if they are gapped, unless the downstream is busy in which case the logic will always wait for gapped input PTPs unless the next PTP has the "potential" to go over the MTU size

spirit:register.spirit:name: mtu_size
spirit:register.spirit:description:
This is the MTU size to use.
Note that the FPGA build must have been built with the highest of normal MTU=1500 or Jumbo MTU=9000 (see max_mtu_size). Accordingly, this value should be less than that.

spirit:register.spirit:name: max_mtu_size
spirit:register.spirit:description: This is the MTU size used during the FPGA build.

spirit:field.spirit:name: force_xgmii_rf
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Instructs the Link Layer TX to send Remote Fault order-set on the XGMII.
This control provides a back-door to Link Fault Signaling that is normally taken care of by the FPGA, and is mutually exclusive with force_xgmii_idle.

spirit:field.spirit:name: force_xgmii_idle
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Instructs the Link Layer TX to send Idle Character on the XGMII.
This control provides a back-door to Link Fault Signaling that is normally taken care of by the FPGA, and is mutually exclusive with force_xgmii_rf.

spirit:register.spirit:name: enable
spirit:register.spirit:description: Indicating a rollover for that particular count has occurred

spirit:register.spirit:name: pending
spirit:register.spirit:description: Indicating a rollover for that particular count has occurred

spirit:register.spirit:name: pending_irq
spirit:register.spirit:description: Registered version of pending & enable

spirit:register.spirit:name: raw
spirit:register.spirit:description: Indicating a rollover for that particular count has occurred

variant.name: none
variant.doc: 'none' variant states including all templates which are not assigned any variant property.
